summary: Build a website that provides a competitive-exam style typing practice interface supporting both Hindi and English typing.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Minimalist keyboard illustration in neutral tones (typing-hero.dim_1600x600.png)
- Simple bilingual icon combining ‘A’ and ‘अ’ as a flat mark (lang-mark.dim_256x256.png)

existing_features.title: Create a responsive typing-practice interface that supports both English and Hindi modes, with a competitive-exam style layout (passage area, typing input, timer, live stats).

Implement the typing-test engine on the frontend: start/pause/reset flow, countdown durations (e.g., 1/3/5/10 minutes), character-by-character comparison against the target passage, and a results screen after time ends.

Add Hindi typing support with Devanagari text passages and correct evaluation for Unicode characters; provide clear on-screen guidance for how to type Hindi (e.g., use a Devanagari keyboard/IME) and ensure the comparison logic handles multi-byte characters correctly.
Provide a small built-in passage library for both English and Hindi and a way to fetch/select passages for practice (random by language at minimum).
Add a coherent visual theme and design system for the app (colors, typography, spacing, components) suitable for an exam/practice environment; avoid blue/purple as primary colors.
Add an optional on-screen results/history section that shows recent attempts by language with key stats, using React Query for data fetching and caching.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a web-based typing practice interface for competitive exams with support for both Hindi and English typing.
Implement backend (single Motoko actor) APIs to serve passages by language and optionally record anonymous session results for basic leaderboards or history (without requiring login).
